problem: An average active person consumes about 2500 Cal a day. (a) What is this in joules? (b) What is this in kilowatt-hours? (c) If your power company charges about 10 ¢ per kilowatt-hour, how much would your energy cost per day if you bought it from the power company? Could you feed yourself on this much money per day?

steps.explanation: We will use the Calorie-joule conversion formula and the Calorie-kilowatt-hour conversion formula to solve this problem.
Define the given values from the problem.
(a) Convert food calories to joules by multiplying the energy in Calories by the conversion factor.
(b) Convert Calories to kilowatt-hours by dividing the energy in Calories by the conversion factor.
(c) Calculate the daily cost by multiplying the energy in kilowatt-hours by the utility rate.
Calculate the final cost and compare to actual food costs.
steps.notations: Cost = $0.29 per day. This is far below real food costs, so you cannot feed yourself on this amount.
